nodes.description: Lola Levkovitch, 70, was one of 30 people killed in a suicide bombing at the Park Hotel in Netanya during a Passover seder.
nodes.support_text: Lola Levkovitch, 70, of Jerusalem was one of 30 people killed in a suicide bombing in the Park Hotel in the coastal city of Netanya, in the midst of the Passover holiday seder.

nodes.description: The terrorist detonated an explosive device in the dining room of the hotel, killing 22 immediately and injuring 140, eight of whom later died.
nodes.support_text: On the eve of Passover, the terrorist walked into the dining room of the hotel, located in the center of Netanya, where 250 guests had just sat down to begin the seder. He detonated an explosive device, killing 22 immediately and injuring 140, eight of whom subsequently died.

nodes.description: The bomber was identified as a member of Hamas Iz a Din al-Kassam Brigades from Tulkarem and was on Israel's wanted list.
nodes.support_text: The bomber was identified as a member of the Hamas Iz a Din al-Kassam Brigades, from the West Bank city of Tulkarem, which is just 10 kilometers (six miles) east of Netanya. He was on the list of wanted terrorists Israel had requested be arrested.

nodes.description: Lola Levkovitch had promised a friend to spend the Passover seder with her in the Park Hotel in Netanya instead of going to Paris with her family.
nodes.support_text: Elisheva had invited her mother to celebrate Passover with them in Paris, but Lola had promised a friend, who was alone, to spend the seder with her in the Park Hotel in Netanya.

nodes.description: Lola Levkovitch was buried in Jerusalem after her death in the bombing.
nodes.support_text: Lola Levkovitch was buried in Jerusalem.

edges.support_text: Lola Levkovitch, 70, of Jerusalem was one of 30 people killed in a suicide bombing in the Park Hotel in the coastal city of Netanya, in the midst of the Passover holiday seder.

On the eve of Passover, the terrorist walked into the dining room of the hotel, located in the center of Netanya, where 250 guests had just sat down to begin the seder. He detonated an explosive device, killing 22 immediately and injuring 140, eight of whom subsequently died.
Elisheva had invited her mother to celebrate Passover with them in Paris, but Lola had promised a friend, who was alone, to spend the seder with her in the Park Hotel in Netanya.
